content.question: Which of the following is not a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-series?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, n to the negative 4 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n to the e power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator e raised to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator e raised to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test to apply.
